# FireICE - Immigration Advocacy & ICE Alert Tool
# https://fireice.info

## About
FireICE is a free, community-powered tool that helps people:
- Get alerts about ICE raids and activity in their area
- Know their rights when encountering ICE
- Find local immigrant support organizations
- Contact elected officials with pre-written scripts
- Find protests and events to attend
- Sign petitions for immigration reform
- Identify ICE contractors and corporations to boycott

## Emergency Hotlines
If you or someone you know encounters ICE, call immediately:
- United We Dream Hotline: 1-844-363-1423 (nationwide, 24/7)
- NILC (National Immigration Law Center): 1-866-267-9506
- RAICES Texas: 1-833-777-2367
- ICE Detainee Locator: 1-888-351-4024

## Know Your Rights
- You have the right to remain silent
- You do not have to open your door for ICE without a JUDICIAL warrant (signed by a judge)
- ICE administrative warrants (Form I-200) do NOT give them the right to enter
- You can say: "I do not consent to entry. Please slide any warrant under the door."
- You have the right to record ICE activity
- You have the right to an attorney

## Key Resources
- ACLU Know Your Rights: https://www.aclu.org/know-your-rights/immigrants-rights
- United We Dream: https://unitedwedream.org
- Immigrant Defense Project Raid Toolkit: https://www.immigrantdefenseproject.org/raids/
- National Immigration Law Center: https://www.nilc.org

## How to Use This Tool
1. Enter your ZIP code or city/state
2. View ICE activity alerts in your area
3. Find your elected officials and call/email them
4. Find local organizations that can help
5. Sign petitions and find protests to attend

## Data Sources
Data is community-sourced and may be incomplete. Users can submit information via the contact form on the website:
- ICE activity reports
- Protest/event info
- Local organizations
- News articles
